channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: death of a 30-year Blackwater man sparks an urgent investigation and major health response

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Public sector pay freeze defended by NSW government as global COVID-19 cases top 5.6 million, Australian death toll stands at 103

item.description: It was not immediately clear whether Trump has the authority to shut down the companies.
item.title: Trump to sign executive order on social media on Thursday: White House

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: Two men are accused of netting thousands of dollars in winning after being privy to Craig Bellamy's Coach of the Year award.
item.title: Police charge two men over Dally M betting sting

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: US death toll passes 100,000; Authorities investigate 30-year-old's death in COVID-free Queensland town

item.description: Twenty clubs have received clearance for players to work together as a squad as restrictions are eased across England.
item.title: Players still wary as EPL returns to full-squad training

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: News Corp has confirmed its plans to axe hundreds of jobs as it moves to a digital-focused future.
item.title: News Corp shuts down more than 100 print titles, hundreds of jobs to go

item.description: Twenty years ago today 200,000 people marched across the Sydney Harbour Bridge to express their support for Aboriginal reconciliation.
item.title: From the Archives, 2000: Bridge Walk for Reconciliation attracts thousands

item.description: Cricket is unusual in how much it revolves around nation v nation contests, but India now makes twice as much from the IPL.
item.title: Pandemic likely to hasten cricket's shift away from the international game

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: The 37-year-old man failed to return home on Tuesday after leaving Hervey Bay for an overnight fishing trip, police say.
item.title: Air and sea search under way for missing Hervey Bay fisherman

item.dc:creator: Alex Druce
item.description: The Australian share market is expected to open higher on Thursday after US markets gained overnight amid positive economic sentiment.
item.title: Strong start tipped for Aussie shares as Wall St surges

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on a seven-race card at Gosford.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Gosford on Thursday

item.dc:creator: Daile Cross
item.description: WA government urged to close a COVID-19 workers’ compensation loophole as it deals with the coranavirus-infected Al-Kuwait vessel and crew members in lockdown at a Perth hotel on Thursday.
item.title: WA Coronavirus LIVE: Global cases surpass 5.6 million, dozens of Al Kuwait crew in hotel lockdown

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Even as Boris Johnson stands by Dominic Cummings, polling numbers reveal new areas of damage in the PM's standing with the public.
item.title: Johnson can't uncouple himself from ticking time bomb in Cummings scandal

item.description: Yes, there are arguments for treating the president differently but If he's going to use Twitter, he doesn't get an exemption because of the office he holds.
item.title: Sorry, President Trump, Twitter makes its own rules

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Prominent Republicans and usually supportive media outlets have criticised Trump for spreading unfounded conspiracy theories about the death of a Florida woman.
item.title: Allies blast Donald Trump's murder conspiracy theory

item.description: China lent billions to poor countries. As the world economy reels, countries are increasingly telling Beijing they can't pay the money back.
item.title: Coronavirus threatens China's Belt and Road loans

item.dc:creator: Aja Styles
item.description: A Swan Valley music and arts festival that likens itself to Burning Man has left a trail of burnt ticket-holders after it cancelled its event due to COVID-19 and then refused to refund or credit festival-goers.
item.title: WA Blazing Swan festival refuses refunds and sits on ticket money nest egg to 'survive' COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: The WA government has sent a senior bureaucrat on a mission to China organised by an organisation advising the Victorian government on its Belt and Road Initiative deal with Beijing.
item.title: WA sends bureaucrat to China on 'Belt and Road' mission after Premier rules out deal with Beijing

item.description: The Nevada Athletic Commission agreed to allow two shows from both sports next month.
item.title: UFC and boxing cleared to return in Vegas

item.description: There will be greater aerodynamic restrictions for the more successful teams in a development handicap system.
item.title: FIA approves F1's budget cap reduction and handicap system

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: Bright start in store for ASX after Wall Street rally

item.description: The global economy could be in for a bumpy ride as lockdowns tied to the COVID-19 pandemic begin to ease, says Goldman Sachs president John Waldron.
item.title: Goldman Sachs warns of a 'start-and-stop' economic recovery

item.description: Jack Miller will step up to Ducati's main MotoGP team next season with an option on 2022.
item.title: Australian Miller to follow in Stoner's racing line, ride for Ducati

item.description: Lufthansa's German government bailout was thrown into doubt after the airline's supervisory board refused to accept the conditions attached by Brussels.
item.title: Lufthansa's $15b rescue hits surprise hurdle as board rejects EU conditions

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Blackwater residents are scrambling to get tested after the death of 30-year-old Nathan Turner, as authorities work to confirm if a Rockhampton nurse was the source of the infection.
item.title: Rush to trace source of seventh and youngest Queensland virus death

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: The S&P 500 closed above 3000 for the first time since March 5, as the further easing of lockdowns lifted optimism for an economic recovery.
item.title: ASX set to rise as Wall Street rally continues

item.description: The countdown was halted less than 16 minutes before the SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket was due to lift off.
item.title: Historic SpaceX rocket launch delayed due to bad weather

item.description: Boeing is slashing around 10 per cent of its workforce, and the aircraft maker says more cuts are coming.
item.title: Boeing slashes 12,000 jobs as virus seizes travel industry

item.description: The pandemic sent shockwaves through the oil industry but there are reasons to believe the worst has passed.
item.title: The demise of oil may have been greatly exaggerated

item.description: The simplest intervention is to limit the amount of blue light emitted from your devices, but there are products that can also help prevent skin damage.
item.title: Screen time isn't great for your skin, but these tips can help

item.description: A Canadian judge has ruled that the US extradition case against a senior Chinese Huawei executive can continue to the next stage.
item.title: Huawei CFO fails to end US extradition fight in Canada

item.description: "No reasonable person can assert today that Hong Kong maintains a high degree of autonomy from China," US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said.
item.title: Hong Kong is no longer autonomous from China, Pompeo says

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Johnson told MPs he "totally understands the public indignation" over the scandal but insisted his top aide would not be sacked.
item.title: Boris Johnson urges UK to 'move on' from Dominic Cummings scandal

item.description: The US President threatened to regulate or shut down social media companies after Twitter added fact checks to two of his tweets.
item.title: 'Big action': Trump threatens social media after Twitter fact-checks him

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: Building products giant Boral is facing its second class action in six weeks over financial irregularities uncovered in its US windows business last year.
item.title: Boral facing second class action over North American windows operations

item.dc:creator: Aja Styles
item.description: After almost 30 years of searching the universe, astronomers using WA’s state-of-the-art telescope have finally solved the mystery of “missing matter” tracing back to the Big Bang.
item.title: Big Bang missing matter finally found in WA breakthrough needed to better map our universe

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 28, 2020

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Regulators are considering urgent changes to prevent electricity retailers going broke as tens of thousands of customers defer bill payments.
item.title: ‘Financial contagion’ from coronavirus may infect electricity market

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: If the teenage Cronulla star's B sample proves positive and intentional use is proven, he will have to pay a heavy penalty. But the one to really go after is the person who presumably advised him to take these drugs.
item.title: Death-wish drug taking: Bronson Xerri allegations truly beggar belief

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: More than half of Australian general practitioners say they have battled critical influenza vaccination shortages caused by distribution problems.
item.title: Critical shortage of flu shots hits regional areas

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Thursday, May 28

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Thursday, May 28

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: A tiny proportion of the teaching workforce is being dismissed for poor performance, but principals say official data does not reflect the true numbers.
item.title: Calls to ramp up scrutiny of teacher performance

item.description: COVID has given us time to turn inwards and consider what it is about life that we truly consider important. It's not all bad.
item.title: When experts found isolation was a great thing – and that debate isn't settled

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: The fund manager also said it is prepared to pump billions into infrastructure investments.
item.title: $156b fund giant IFM fears early access to super precedent

item.dc:creator: Pru Goward
item.description: The trade-offs that Bob Hawke could offer Australian workers are not available to Scott Morrison. He is right to attempt industrial reform, but it is a courageous and challenging path.
item.title: Industrial reform will be PM's Everest – it won't resemble Hawke's Accord

item.description: Exhaustive reviews stress the importance of self-determination, yet the NSW government has cut funding to a crucial voice for Indigenous families.
item.title: We can't return to business as usual: Aboriginal voices critical to child protection

item.description: Scott Morrison was re-elected as Prime Minister in 2019 with no policies. Now he plunders innovative – and successful – ideas from the ALP.
item.title: Everything old is new again as PM plunders Labor's ideas
